authors.author: Gerald S. Henderson Thomas Tallis William Cowper

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: God moves in a mysterious way newline His glorious wonders to perform; newline He plants His footsteps in the sea newline And rides upon the storm.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Deep in unfathomable mines newline Of never failing skill newline He treasures up His bright designs, newline And works His sovereign will.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Ye fearful saints, fresh courage take. newline The clouds ye so much dread newline Are big with mercy, and shall break, newline In blessings on your head.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Judge not the Lord by feeble sense, newline But trust Him for His grace; newline Behind a frowning providence newline He hides a smiling face.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: His purposes will ripen fast, newline Unfolding every hour: newline The bud may have a bitter taste newline But sweet will be the flower.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Blind unbelief is sure to err, newline And scan His work in vain: newline God is His own interpreter, newline And He will make it plain.
